messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: New and Improved Links & AMAZING COSPLAY PHOTOS
messages.msgSnippet: omoshiroisou... thx for sharing !!! kikue.mugen  wrote: So many Shinsengumi in one spot. Great photos. ... Get easy, one-click access
messages.messageBody:
omoshiroisou... thx for sharing !!!

"kikue.mugen" <kikue.mugen@...> wrote:

So many Shinsengumi in one spot. Great photos.

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
>
> Over the years some Japanese sites are upgraded and here are some good
> examples
>
> http://www.goryokaku-tower.co.jp/
> (watch the slide show and see some of the artifacts.
> Goryokaku in Hakodate on Hokkaido Isl. is truly the Shinsengumi's last
> stand)---oh and try not to get completely creeped out by the animated
> chibi Goryokaku on the left (*_*)
>
> http://www.hijikata-toshizo.jp/
> looks great and the links page also lists the Byakkotai museum
>
> I have to give a thumbs down for this page
> http://www.city.hino.tokyo.jp/shinsenr/
> the blinking is really really unhealthy for readers XD
>
> ----------------------
> OUTSTANDING PHOTOS
> ----------------------
> YOU DO NOT WANT TO MISS THIS !
> http://hinojyukuhonjin-kentoukai.blog.drecom.jp/category_6/
>
> *look carefully....a western cosplayer part of this event!
>
> *there is a man who (to me) looks like he does not mind cosplaying as
> the NHK version of Takeda XD ---serious ! check it out ! (look for
> the golden fan)
>
> *although this is a Shinsengumi event, if you look carefully there are
> cosplayers also representing Aizu forces as well
>
> *note the "indoctrination" of young Shinsengumi fans
>
> I'm not a fan of face fuzz on men...but for this guy---it works!
> http://blog.drecom.jp/hinojyukuhonjin_kentoukai/img/406/hino_7660a.jpg
>
> I happen to be a fan of Japanese fans, and maybe in the future I can
> go to Japan and make a documentary about Shinsengumi fans and
> interview them and ask...
>
> "why"?
>
> XD
>

messages.subject: New and Improved Links & AMAZING COSPLAY PHOTOS
messages.msgSnippet: Over the years some Japanese sites are upgraded and here are some good examples http://www.goryokaku-tower.co.jp/ (watch the slide show and see some of the
messages.messageBody:
Over the years some Japanese sites are upgraded and here are some good
examples

http://www.goryokaku-tower.co.jp/
(watch the slide show and see some of the artifacts.
Goryokaku in Hakodate on Hokkaido Isl. is truly the Shinsengumi's last
stand)---oh and try not to get completely creeped out by the animated
chibi Goryokaku on the left (*_*)

http://www.hijikata-toshizo.jp/
looks great and the links page also lists the Byakkotai museum

I have to give a thumbs down for this page
http://www.city.hino.tokyo.jp/shinsenr/
the blinking is really really unhealthy for readers XD

----------------------
OUTSTANDING PHOTOS
----------------------
YOU DO NOT WANT TO MISS THIS !
http://hinojyukuhonjin-kentoukai.blog.drecom.jp/category_6/

*look carefully....a western cosplayer part of this event!

*there is a man who (to me) looks like he does not mind cosplaying as
the NHK version of Takeda XD ---serious ! check it out ! (look for
the golden fan)

*although this is a Shinsengumi event, if you look carefully there are
cosplayers also representing Aizu forces as well

*note the "indoctrination" of young Shinsengumi fans

I'm not a fan of face fuzz on men...but for this guy---it works!
http://blog.drecom.jp/hinojyukuhonjin_kentoukai/img/406/hino_7660a.jpg

I happen to be a fan of Japanese fans, and maybe in the future I can
go to Japan and make a documentary about Shinsengumi fans and
interview them and ask...

"why"?

XD
